member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.ConnectorBase.FirstSegmentOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of FirstSegement.
member.remarks:
The OrthogonalLineConnector lets you orient the FirstSegment in follwoing directions
Auto - FirstSegment of Orthogonal LineConnector is connected to the HeadNode based on the Position of HeadNode, TailNode and provided IntermediatePoint.
Horizontal - FirstSegment of the Orthogonal LineConnector is connected Horizontally to the HeadNode.
Vertical - FirstSegment of the Orthogonal LineConnector is connected Vertically to the HeadNode. /// Default orientation is Auto.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.LineConnector
member.summary: Represents the Connectors to be used for making connections between the nodes.
member.remarks:
Connectors are objects that are used to create a link between two nodes. The node where the connection starts is known as the head node. The node where the connection ends is known as the tail node.
Three types of connectors are provided :Orthogonal, Straight and Bezier.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.Node
member.summary: Represents the node class.
member.remarks: Nodes are graphical objects that can be drawn on the page by selecting them from the Symbol Palette and dropping them on the page, or they can be added through code behind.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape
member.summary: Interface to a node in a hierarchy or graph of objects.

remarks.para: A node is a named object in a hierarchical tree structure. Each node has a child and a parent. A node's name must is unique within the scope of its parent node. The Full name of a node is unique within the scope of the entire node hierarchy.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Move(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Moves the node, the argument being the motion vector.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.FullName
member.summary: Gets the full name.
member.remarks: The full name is the name of the node concatenated with the names of all parent nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.OffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical offset X.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical offset Y.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.InDegree
member.summary: Gets the in-degree of the node, the number of edges for which this node is the target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.OutDegree
member.summary: Gets the out-degree of the node, the number of edges for which this node is the source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Degree
member.summary: Gets the degree of the node, the number of edges for which this node is either the source or the target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.InEdges
member.summary: Gets the collection of all incoming edges, those for which this node is the target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.IsFixed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is fixed.
member.value: true if this instance is fixed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.IsExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is expanded.
member.value: true if this instance is expanded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.ID
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of this node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets the model.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.OutEdges
member.summary: Gets the collection of all outgoing edges, those for which this node is the source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Edges
member.summary: Gets the collection of all incident edges, those for which this node is either the source or the target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.InNeighbors
member.summary: Gets the collection of all adjacent nodes connected to this node by an incoming edge (i.e., all nodes that "point" at this one).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.OutNeighbors
member.summary: Gets the collection of adjacent nodes connected to this node by an outgoing edge (i.e., all nodes "pointed" to by this one).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Neighbors
member.summary: Gets the neighbors.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.ParentNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.ParentEdge
member.summary: Gets or sets the edge between this node and its parent node in a tree structure.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Depth
member.summary: Gets or sets the tree depth of this node. The root's tree depth is zero, and each level of the tree is one depth level greater.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.ChildCount
member.summary: Gets the number of tree children of this node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.FirstChild
member.summary: Gets this node's first tree child.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.LastChild
member.summary: Gets this node's last tree child.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets this node's previous tree sibling.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets this node's next tree sibling.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.Children
member.summary: Gets or sets an iterator over this node's tree children.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.ActualWidth
member.summary: Gets the Actual Width.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.ActualHeight
member.summary: Gets the Actual Height.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.IShape.IsDragConnectionOver
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is drag connection over.
member.value: true if this instance is drag connection over; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the parent nodes based on the connections in a hierarchical layout.

member.summary: Apply effect for Node without using Framework Effect property. Issue Details: When an effect is applied to a Node, printing a diagram page results in clipping of Node. member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramModel
member.summary: Represents the Diagram Model.

remarks.para: A model represents data for an application and contains the logic for adding, accessing, and manipulating the data. Nodes and connectors are added to the Diagram Control using the Model property. A predefined layout can be applied using the LayoutType property of DiagramModel or the position of the nodes can be manually specified.

member.summary: Represents the Diagram Model.

remarks.para: A model represents data for an application and contains the logic for adding, accessing, and manipulating the data. Nodes and connectors are added to the Diagram Control using the Model property. A predefined layout can be applied using the LayoutType property of DiagramModel or the position of the nodes can be manually specified.

example.code: <Window x:Class="Sample.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="http://schemas.syncfusion.com/wpf" WindowState="Maximized" Name="mainwindow" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Sample" FontWeight="Bold" Icon="Images/App.ico" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramModel LayoutType="TableLayout" RowCount="3" ColumnCount="3" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="50" x:Name="diagramModel" > </syncfusion:DiagramModel> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramModel.EnableCycleDetection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Cycle detection is enabled or not.
member.value: true if cycle detection is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In case of , if there exists a cycle in the input , then EnableCycleDetection property should be set to true. A cycle is said to exist when for example: say three nodes n1,n2,n3 are there such that, n1 is connected to n2, n2 is connected to n3 and n3 is again connected to n1.(n1-->n2-->n3-->n1) n1,n2,n3 are said to form a cycle then.

example.code: <Window x:Class="Sample.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="http://schemas.syncfusion.com/wpf" WindowState="Maximized" Name="mainwindow" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Sample" FontWeight="Bold" Icon="Images/App.ico" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramModel EnableCycleDetection="True" Orientation="TopBottom" LayoutType="HierarchicalTreeLayout" x:Name="diagramModel" > </syncfusion:DiagramModel> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramModel.EnableLayoutWithVariedSizes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable the varied size algorithm. In case the Model consists of the nodes of different sizes, this property can be set to true. This will align the differently sized nodes with respect to the centre.
member.value: true if [enable layout with varied sizes]; otherwise, false.

example.code: <Window x:Class="Sample.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="http://schemas.syncfusion.com/wpf" WindowState="Maximized" Name="mainwindow" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Sample" FontWeight="Bold" Icon="Images/App.ico" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramModel LayoutType="TableLayout" TableExpandMode="Vertical" RowCount="3" ColumnCount="3" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="50" x:Name="diagramModel" > </syncfusion:DiagramModel> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramModel.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation.
member.remarks:
The Layout Manager lets you orient the tree in many directions and can be used for the creation of many sophisticated arrangements.
TopBottom - Places the root node at the top and the child nodes are arranged below the root node.
BottomTop - Places the root node at the Bottom and the child nodes are arranged above the root node.
LeftRight - Places the root node at the Left and the child nodes are arranged on the right side of the root node.
RightLeft - Places the root node at the Right and the child nodes are arranged on the left side of the root node. Default orientation is TopBottom.

example.code: <Window x:Class="Sample.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="http://schemas.syncfusion.com/wpf" WindowState="Maximized" Name="mainwindow" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Sample" FontWeight="Bold" Icon="Images/App.ico" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramModel Orientation="TopBottom" LayoutType="DirectedTreeLayout" x:Name="diagramModel" > </syncfusion:DiagramModel> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.HierarchicalTreeLayout
member.summary: Represents the Hierarchical Tree layout.
member.remarks: The Hierarchical Tree Layout also arranges nodes in a tree-like structure however unlike the directed tree layout, the nodes in hierarchical layout may have multiple parents. As a result, there is no need to specify the layout root. Nodes can have multiple parents in this layout.

example.code: <UserControl x:Class="Sample.MainPage" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="clr-namespace:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram;assembly=Syncfusion.Diagram.Silverlight" xmlns:vsm="clr-namespace:System.Windows;assembly=System.Windows" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramModel LayoutType="HierarchicalTreeLayout" HorizontalSpacing="30" VerticalSpacing="50" SpaceBetweenSubTrees="50" x:Name="diagramModel" > </syncfusion:DiagramModel> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.TableLayout
member.summary: Represents the Tablelayout used for the automatic arrangement of nodes.
member.remarks: TableLayout arranges the nodes in a tabular structure based on specified intervals between them. The number of nodes in each row and column could be specified and the layout will take place accordingly. The nodes are assigned rows and columns based on the order in which they are added to the model and based on the maximum nodes allowed in that row and column. This layout enables to layout nodes automatically without the need to specify offset positions for each node.

example.code: <UserControl x:Class="Sample.MainPage" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="clr-namespace:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram;assembly=Syncfusion.Diagram.Silverlight" xmlns:vsm="clr-namespace:System.Windows;assembly=System.Windows" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramModel LayoutType="TableLayout" EnableLayoutWithVariedSizes="False" TableExpandMode="Horizontal" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="50" RowCount="3" ColumnCount="3" x:Name="diagramModel" > </syncfusion:DiagramModel> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.Model> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.HorizontalRuler
member.summary: Represents the horizontal ruler.
member.remarks: Rulers display the coordinates of elements on the . Negative label values get displayed on the ruler in case the page is panned to the right side. On Zooming, the ruler values get adjusted accordingly, to match with the current Zoom level. At any point, the ruler value always indicates the exact coordinates of the page and its elements. So when the page is zoomed, the interval values get halved or doubled depending upon the zoom level.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramPage
member.summary:
Represents the diagram page .
The DiagramPage is just a container to hold the objects(nodes and connectors) added through model. The DiagramView uses the page to display the diagram objects.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramControl
member.summary: Represents the Diagram control.

remarks.para: The Diagram control is the base class which contains the view and the model. It receives user input and translates it into actions and commands on the model and view. It also implements symbol palette and scrolling, and enables horizontal and vertical scrollbars when the size of the view exceeds the size of the window.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.FilterRibbonButton.CornerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which the corners of a are rounded.
member.value: Type: The CornerRadius that describes the degree to which corners are rounded. This property has no default value.
member.remarks: Although the property name suggests that you can use only singular values, CornerRadius also supports non-uniform radii. Radius values that are too large are scaled so that they blend smoothly from corner to corner.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.SymbolPaletteFilter
member.summary: Represents SymbolPaletteFilter class.
member.remarks:
A Symbol Palette filter can be added to the control, using the SymbolFilters property, so that only desired Symbol Palette groups get displayed. The SetFilterIndexes property is used to specify the index value of the filters for which the group is to be displayed.
The filter names are specified integer values, with the first filter index starting from 0. Based on the filter indexes specified for that particular group, the visibility of the group is controlled. So the group gets displayed only when any of the specified filter names are selected.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramView
member.summary:
Represents the Diagram View.
The view obtains data from the model and presents them to the user. It typically manages the overall layout of the data obtained from model. Apart from presenting the data, view also handles navigation between the items, and some aspects of item selection. The views also implements basic user interface features, such as rulers, and drag and drop. It handles the events, which occur on the objects, obtained from the model. Command mechanism is also implemented by the view.
Represents the Diagram View Print and Export.

remarks.para: The view obtains data from the model and presents them to the user. It typically manages the overall layout of the data obtained from model. Apart from presenting the data, view also handles navigation between the items, and some aspects of item selection. The views also implements basic user interface features, such as rulers, and drag and drop, printing and exporting. It handles the events, which occur on the objects, obtained from the model. Command mechanism is also implemented by the view.

The print feature enables the user to set a printer to be used, and it allows the user to define the pages and the number of copies that should be printed. It also provides an overview of the document, showing how the document will appear when printed.
The page can also be exported to various image formats.

param.name: imageStretch
param.para: Specify how to stretch the image.
Expand: Image can expand but not shrink to fit the desired Size (image size)
Shrink: Image can shrink but not expand to fit the desired Size (image size)
Best Fit : Image will expand or shrink to fit the desired Size (image size)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramView.PortVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the port visibility.
member.remarks: Setting PortVisibility from DiagramView applies to all the nodes in the page. However if any node has specifically set PortVisibility, then the node's PortVisibility property will be taken into account only for that node. So even if DiagramView's PortVisibility is set to false, if Node's is set to true then the ports will be displayed for that node.

example.code: <Window x:Class="RulersAndUnits.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="http://schemas.syncfusion.com/wpf" Title="Rulers And Units Demo" WindowState="Maximized" Name="mainwindow" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Sample" FontWeight="Bold" Icon="Images/App.ico" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView IsPageEditable="True" Background="LightGray" Bounds="0,0,12,12" PortVisibility="False" Name="diagramView" > <syncfusion:HorizontalRuler Name="horizontalRuler" /> </syncfusion:DiagramView.HorizontalRuler> <syncfusion:DiagramView.VerticalRuler> <syncfusion:VerticalRuler Name="verticalRuler" /> </syncfusion:DiagramView.VerticalRuler > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Diagram.DiagramView.EnableConnection

example.code: <Window x:Class="RulersAndUnits.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:syncfusion="http://schemas.syncfusion.com/wpf" Title="Rulers And Units Demo" WindowState="Maximized" Name="mainwindow" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Sample" FontWeight="Bold" Icon="Images/App.ico" > <syncfusion:DiagramControl Grid.Column="1" Name="diagramControl" IsSymbolPaletteEnabled="True" Background="WhiteSmoke"> <syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> <syncfusion:DiagramView EnableConnection="True" Bounds="0,0,12,12" Name="diagramView" > <syncfusion:HorizontalRuler Name="horizontalRuler" /> </syncfusion:DiagramView.HorizontalRuler> <syncfusion:DiagramView.VerticalRuler> <syncfusion:VerticalRuler Name="verticalRuler" /> </syncfusion:DiagramView.VerticalRuler > </syncfusion:DiagramView> </syncfusion:DiagramControl.View> </syncfusion:DiagramControl> </Window>
